page.title: 03ATTITUDES AND FEARS
page.content: The majority of villagers in Collier Street would not like more estates being built because they prefer the character of the old houses.They fear greatly that any more people would destroy the character of the village. Most houses are on cess- pool drainage and villagers fear that if houses got main drainage lots more people would be attracted and more estates would be built.Villagers believe that the shop is vitally important to the community. Elderly and lonely people go there and can be certain of meeting at least one person to talk to.One person,on behalf of every villager,said that "They did not like grass track racing at all... they think it is too noisy."The same lady said that she doesn't like extensions because they do not always seem to be in keeping with older parts of the buildings.
